background: The Wind River Watershed Project is a multi-agency watershed-scaleeffort to restore wild Wind River steelhead through habitat restoration and a robust RM and E program. Streamflow measurements on the Wind River are used to help manage juvenile traps, and to provide data for design and monitoring of habitat restoration work in the drainage.
title: Discharge Measurement
assumptions: Stream stage measurements can be used to approximate stream discharge using an established rating curve developed at the monitoring location.
objectives: Provide hourly streamflow data available in realtime.
